abstract: The resignation of the chief executive of the Mexican maker of Corona beer that is 50 percent owned by Anheuser-Busch may play a pivotal role in a possible takeover battle with InBev.
snippet: The resignation of the chief executive of the Mexican maker of Corona beer that is 50 percent owned by Anheuser-Busch may play a pivotal role in a possible takeover battle with InBev.
lead_paragraph: Carlos Fernandez Gonzalez, the chief executive of Grupo Modelo, resigned Friday from the board of Anheuser-Busch as it began an all-day meeting to weigh a $46.4 billion takeover bid from rival InBev.

headline.main: Chief of Mexican Brewery Quits Busch Board
headline.print_headline: Chief of Mexican Brewery Quits Busch Board
